name: The Westin Verasa Napa

reviews.title: Loved it
reviews.text: Note this is, to my opinion, a 4-star property, so I am rating it accordingly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Pros
reviews.title: Not worth going back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: - Great location, just a few minutes from the many wineries at Napa
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel near Oxbow Market and Downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: - Complimentary evening wine tastings
reviews.title: All around good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Great pool and large jacuzzi with views of the river
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Wonderful Staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First off, as a Westin property, this is a nice hotel. Its new, has heavenly beds and large and comfortable rooms. the ceilings in our room were about 14 feet high which we actually found cavernous, especially with a 30 inch flat screen tv the only thing on one wall! The issue with this property is really the location. Its in a construction site and is in no way a resort although a "resort fee" of $20 is charged for internet and parking and is not optional. There is nothing romantic or charming about this place so if you are looking for a Napa experience that includes these things, I don't recommend it. The hotel manager advised me that this hotel is very high on the list of Starwood points redemption and I can understand why. I wouldn't however pay the rates they charge again - its really just another Westin charging resort type rates.
reviews.title: Not the Napa experience we were expecting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We bought a package stay and they debited our charge card 3 weeks before we arrived. That was okay, but when we arrived at 5:30, they didn't have a room for us! It took 1/2 hour to get it straightened out. They offered to buy us something in the cafe while we waited. Once we got our room, we started to go leave the cafe, and we were chased down by an employee and they shouted at us in the foyer that we needed to sign for the food. We had to explain the whole situation to them and finally convinced them to talk to the manager. They didn't have any vending machines for soda, and didn't go out of their way to try to help find one. Most of the employees I dealt with were not very accomodating or friendly. There was lots of car noise in the room, and when the wine train went by, they woke us up with their constant blowing of their horn.
reviews.title: I'll never stay there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel has a good location in Napa - within 20 minutes of the main Silverado Trail / Napa Valley wineries. As my review title states, this hotel is typical of any other Westin (cleanliness, rooms, etc). The hotel is new and is located directly next to the wine train if that's something you're interested in.
reviews.title: Typical Westin, but in Napa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food in the restaurant was quite good (we had breakfast there one morning and dessert another night).
reviews.title: Very romantic place in great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The one thing of note at this hotel is that they charge an "amenity fee" of $20 per night, whether you park a car there or not. It's no big deal, but I've never seen that at a Westin, or any other Starwood hotel before.
reviews.title: This is the best place to stay in Napa!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is at a great location in the town of Napa. You can walk to restaurants and shops, and the Westin provided a terrific little pocket map with a 3 mile or a 5 mile run/walk through a nice area of town (which included a shopping area, a park, and a neighborhood). The rooms (mine was a suite) were very comfy with great bedding and towels, and it was very convenient to have the kitchenette in the room as well. The decor inside and out was chic and modern. The only thing I would improve was the wifi internet (it was free) but it was very slow. I would stay here again for sure.
reviews.title: Great Stay- Good location in town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff was very gracious. The rooms were well appointed. Some suggestions for managment: 1. You charge a $20.00 per night amenity fee. Put a bottle of water in the room daily. It doesn't cost much. 2. Put an outlet on the desk for items that have to be plugged in. 3. Put a plastic bag in the ice bucket, They are not always clean. 4. Check the refridgerator temp. it froze my water.
reviews.title: The hotel was lovely.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I work for a large Pharmaceutical company and we enjoyed our annual meeting here this year. My first experience here was in December 2010 when I met with the meeting/events Manager, who was more than helpful, and even served me coffee while she typed up my event contract. My second experience was arrival for the event in late April 2011, and the service was exceptional starting with the valet who assisted me with huge boxes full of meeting stuff, as did the meeting set-up assistants.
reviews.title: Business meetings need apply here for best experience ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon check-in, I was amazed at how wonderful the room looked, as were my guests/clients for my meeting.
reviews.title: Best Pet Friendly hotel in the Napa Valley

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next day during the meeting, everything went very well, and the food we ordered for our hotel catered lunch was fabulous! Many of my guests/clients thanked me for the wonderful menu. I remarked "it's to take credit for the hotels hard work." After lunch, one of my guests requested an additional serving to go, and they accomodated her with a smile.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I must admit that my husband and I were on our way to a family reunion and we just needed one night in peace (January 1) before heading over to the condos with the rest of our family. We booked with out points on New Years morning and headed out from San Francisco.
reviews.title: Nice Resort Option in Napa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since we didn't spend much time here, arriving about 3pm and only just lounging around before leaving at 10am the next morning, I can't comment on many of the features and amenities at the hotel. But I will comment on what I did experience. The hotel seems really big once your inside, long hallways of rooms. The room itself was nice, but I feel like it was really plain. I think they could have done a lot more by adding in a little 'wine country' flair. Everything was neutral colors, the room, while big enough, definitely wasn't huge. Flat screen TV, large closet and big bathroom (although not a separate tub and shower and only one sink).
reviews.title: Great Time / Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was always friendly and the valet was pretty efficient both times we got the car. he was also helpful with directions.
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I both will come back to experience this hotel fully, we noticed a huge outdoor pool and large spa, but there was a complaint about the noise coming from the spa late at night. The building is in a U shape with the pool and spa in the middle and even though it didn't sound like the people in the hot tub were speaking to loudly, it carried easily to my window.
reviews.title: New star in the Valley

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Really no big complaints on this one, but again, we didn't get to experience much of it. Really looking forward to another stay in the future though, although I'm sure it will be expensive as it wasn't even a deal in off-season.
reviews.title: Nice hotel; Service can be improved!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011
reviews.text: We stayed the night at the Westin. The stonework was gorgeous. My Favorite style is more contemporary. This hotel is exceptionally beautiful. It brings the outdoor elements in. I love the rooms and the hotel itself.
reviews.title: Didn't want to leave!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: My only complaint was that I actually heard dogs barking and walking down the hall in the hotel. That was a little ridiculous. We were also irritated that 15% gratuity was automatically added to everything from a single cocktail to a breakfast for two. We thought that was a little insulting. All in all though a gorgeous hotel and a lovely stay.
reviews.title: Appalling service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Checked in with family into a 2 bedroom suite. Design of the sliding bathroom door is such that one can look right into the bathroom toilet through the gap between the door and the wall. The guy who came to fix the problem tried to avoid doing anything by saying that is the design of the hotel. I then escalated the problem to the manager before the same guy came back to fix it. The following day, we came back from to our rooms at 5pm, expecting to take a rest before going out again for dinner. To our dismay, the rooms were NOT done up. When I reported the problem, the woman answering at the "service express" said that the time for doing the rooms each day is 9 to 530pm - meaning there is nothing wrong. Came 5:30pm, still no one came to clean up our rooms until I called and complained again.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, Great Service, Great Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Do you need that when you are supposed to be relaxing and unwinding? No more Westin for me, I am afraid.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: www.ourcherishedlife.com
reviews.title: Can't wait to return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I booked a long weekend stay, Sat - Mon, at Westin Verasa Napa using 12,000 Starwood points per night. I am a Platinum member and I was so happy to get an upgrade to a one bedroom. You get the WOW factor the moment you open the door to the room. I arrived at noon and was told that check-in was at 3 pm, so I left to go to my favorite local shopping destination, Napa Premium Outlets. To get to the Westin, take the Lincoln Ave exit instead of the First St, it's a more direct route.
reviews.title: Best Weekend Stay Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: When I returned, the check in was speedy and efficient. I was informed of the $20. per day, resort fee, but not much else. The fee covered the valet parking, business center (one computer with free internet and printer/copier), pool, and Westin WorkOut room. The valet service was excellent and my bags arrive within a few minutes. Ballentine provided great service and showed me how to use the Xbox to watch DVD.
reviews.title: Great stay at a nice, new property.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The one bedroom unit is huge and has living area (with flat panel TV, Xbox, iPod dock), dining area (seats four), full kitchen with granite counter top, dishwasher, full refrigerator with ice and cold water in the door, electric stove and oven, microwave, toaster, dishes, pots/pans, Starbucks coffee and maker, tea and bottle water.
reviews.title: Westin Verasa Valentine's Day Weekend a Smash!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedroom has Westin Heavenly bed, flat panel TV, in room safe and two robes. The bathroom is large with separate shower and tub, dual sinks. In room services include, internet for a fee, pay per view movies and spa services can be arranged. The room did not have a view, but a nice balcony. Next time I will ask for a room looking onto the river.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel in the heart of downtown Napa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The housekeeping did a great job, typically, they put the dishes in the dishwasher and turn it on, but this time, they unload and put dishes back into the cabinets. They were very friendly when I wanted to peek into the other size rooms to see the smaller and bigger units. Also, the turn down service has yummy chocolates on your bed and I was able to get an extra pack of Starbucks coffee! The rooms are very well done and the decor is beautiful and subtle.
reviews.title: Not so heavenly beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So nice place, that's about it. We had a half of roll of toilet paper in our room and no replacement! Unbelievable! Two of the lights were out, and this is just not the expectation of this hotel. The worst part is that they charged us TWICE for a one night stay. They still have not got back to me about the charge. I have called them three times today with the answer "the accountant is in a meeting". With all of these problems I bet she will be in a meeting for a long time!
reviews.title: Not at all what we expected, horrible experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel was modern, clean, spacious. The style of the hotel is Craftsman. The entry is spacious but rather plain. There is a bar serving lots of the local wines. There is a very expensive restaurant attached the hotel.
reviews.title: A good hotel to explore the Napa Valley wine country

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We paid for their standard room which was a suite. The King bed was extremely comfortable. There was a sofa bed that was also suprisingly(!) comfortable for a pullout. An LCD TV in both the bedroom and living room. A kitchen with all the utensils and a couple of packets of Starbucks. Spacious bathroom was beautiful with lots of marble, glass and stone. What was unusual about the room was the presence of a stationary bicycle, medicine ball, free weights, exercise ball, and lots of exercising accessories.
reviews.title: Westin Verasa makes you feel special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: The staff of the hotel really tried hard to please and one could sense lots of great customer service training. However, the valets (mandatory) doubled as Bell boys and there seemed to be only two per shift. Felt very sorry as they were really running their tails off to please while customers had to wait awhile on their cars.
reviews.title: Very Nice Stay and a Beautiful Westin!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The reader should be aware this this hotel is situated just over a river and adjacent to the town of Napa. It is located on the extreme southern end of the Napa Valley. With a car it is a five minute drive to the beginning of the vineyards. The only reason I mention this is because some of the photos give the impression this might be a hotel in the country overlooking or amongst the vineyards which it is not. If you want that (and I would recommend it) consider Yountville, St. Helena, or Calistoga (note that the distance between Napa on the southern end of the valley and Calistoga on the north end is only about 35 miles on a superb road (not so superb driving if you have tasted too many wines). However, Westin does offer quality at a more affordable price then the boutique Inns and hotels deeper in the valley.
reviews.title: not a four star yet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011
reviews.text: Am and have been a Starwood member for a few years. Sheets were horrible, hav ent experienced something like that since the 80s. Pillow wz honestly worse. Hate to say the sevice was equal. Dear friend with us had flown in her wedding cake, we checked it in with app 10hrs til the celebration. The hotel not only crushed the beautiful cake but didn't offer any more than we're sorry. Very Sad!
reviews.title: Worst Westin we've ever stayed in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel, definitely lives up to the Westin standards. Room super clean and new. The mini kitchen area really helped (dinner leftovers became brunch/late night snacks). Love the westin wind-down (drinks and canapes nightly 5-7). Valet group was super friendly.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Downsides - don't attempt to eat at "the Bank". We had Sunday brunch & it was the slowest service EVER. took 20 minutes to get ice water; they brought coffee without sugar - I asked 3 times for sugar, then stole it from another table. Our waitress disappeared and the restaurant was empty. I never got water or coffee refilled. It was sub-par -- do the "take away" stuff instead.
reviews.title: Love it and exceptional Service ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, the gym is bad. There is one elliptical, two bikes (one was broken) and 3 treadmills. It was a pathetic attempt at a gym, and it was PACKED in the mornings. Especially for California, this was very disappointing.
reviews.title: very new

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Also, just a heads up, there's a $20 resort fee that included free internet and valet. the internet worked intermittently.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, excellent staff, poor restaurant breakfast service

description: The Westin Verasa Napa is located downtown near the heart of Wine Country. Just steps from the famous Wine Train, our hotel has 5-star dining and 3,200+ sq ft of event space.
